data.title: Niklas Luhmann’s slip box: the challenges of a digital edition
data.meta_description: Jan 16, 2019: Digital humanities lecture series – digital knowledge
data.text:
Time: January 16, 2019, 5:30 p.m. (CET) Venue: University of Stuttgart

M 11.82

Keplerstraße 11

70174 Stuttgart

Download as iCal:

Johannes Schmidt and Sebastian Zimmer (Köln/Bielefeld): Niklas Luhmann’s slip box: the challenges of a digital edition

The Digital Humanities department at the Institute of Literary Studies is organizing a lecture series for the winter semester. The series is entitled "Digital Humanities – Digital Knowledge". The title refers to both knowledge in digital form and the practice of working with and on digital objects with computer-supported methods.

Furthermore, “digital knowledge” also refers to a knowledge of “digital”. The lecture series questions the use of computer-supported methods and their epistemological and social consequences in specialist fields and in wider culture and society.

Event language: German
